TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit XamlLoadPermission extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission implements class System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission

Docs.summary: Declares permissions for loading types from assemblies that are used by a XAML reader or writer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks XamlLoadPermission is relevant for scenarios such as whether internal types are permitted to load under partial trust.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlAccessLevel> allowedAccess) cil managed

Docs.param: An enumerable set of specific values.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, using an enumerable set of specific values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A call to this constructor initializes the <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.AllowedAccess%2A> collection with each `allowedAccess` entry as an item, and sets the return for <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.IsUnrestricted%2A> to `false` in the created instance.

Docs.exception: contained invalid information, such as a null item.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState state) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, using existing permissions.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> sets the return for <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.IsUnrestricted%2A> to `true` in the created instance. Any call to this constructor sets the <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.AllowedAccess%2A> collection to `null` because it is not relevant if permissions are being reported rather than <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlAccessLevel>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlAccessLevel allowedAccess) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, using a single value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A call to this constructor initializes the <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.AllowedAccess%2A> collection with `allowedAccess` as the only item, and sets the return for <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.IsUnrestricted%2A> to `false` in the created instance.

Docs.summary: Gets the list of all values that this represents.
Docs.value: A read-only list of values, or . See Remarks.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the current <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission> is initialized such that <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.IsUnrestricted%2A> is `true`, AllowedAccess may be `null`.

Docs.param: A to intersect with the current . Can be .
Docs.summary: Creates and returns a that is the intersection of the current and the specified permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For union, intersect, and subset logic, <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.IsUnrestricted%2A> is checked first, and might return a result based solely on that check. Next, <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.AllowedAccess%2A> is checked.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsSubsetOf(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission that is to be tested for the subset relationship. Can be .
Docs.summary: Determines whether the current is a subset of the specified permission.
Docs.returns: if the current is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks For union, intersect, and subset logic, <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.IsUnrestricted%2A> is checked first, and might return a result based solely on that check. Next, <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.AllowedAccess%2A> is checked.
If `target` is `null` and the current <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission> is both <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.IsUnrestricted%2A> `false` and has an empty <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.AllowedAccess%2A> list, this method returns `true`.

Docs.exception: is not or is not a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks For union, intersect, and subset logic, <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.IsUnrestricted%2A> is checked first, and might return a result based solely on that check. Next, <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.AllowedAccess%2A> is checked.
If `other` is `null`, the current <xref:System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission> is returned.
